JobTitle: Engineering Manager, Machine Learning & Data Science (Remote...
Content_text:
Do you hate advertising? We do too. Our view is that the advertising business is broken and needs to change, and we are a big part of the answer. Jun Group means truth, and our culture is about openness, honesty and innovation. We work with the largest brands in the world to run advertisements that are 100% opt-in, putting consumers in control and turning the industry on its head.

We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning and Data Engineer to join our server team. This position is full-time and 100% remote with the option of working on-site once it is safe to do so. Jun Group will only consider candidates for this position who are currently legally authorized to work in the United States.

Who you are

You enjoy a fun, creative, and engaging working atmosphere free of brilliant jerks
You want to be part of a small team inside a large company with massive opportunity for growth
You enjoy collaboration with other teams including product, biz dev, and our in-house QA team
You eagerly dig into complex engineering problems

What you'll do

Manage and grow a team of talented data scientists and machine learning engineers working across several different projects
Be hands-on when necessary to meet a deadline or develop a proof of concept
Collaborate with leadership from our Server, Mobile, QA, and Product teams to deliver machine learning solutions that will drive our business forward
Experiment with new tech to find the right tool for the job
Use Kanban to manage multiple releases per week
Maintain high code quality through code reviews and automated tests

Qualifications

You have experience hiring and managing engineering teams
You have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems at scale in Java, Python, Scala, or similar languages
Experience working with streaming and batch data processing tools like Apache Beam, Spark, Flink, etc.
You've built and maintained an ETL pipeline using a data warehouse like BigQuery or Redshift
Data engineering experience, including SQL and manipulating large structured or unstructured datasets for analysis
Practical knowledge of how to build efficient end-to-end ML workflows
Familiarity with Python machine learning tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, etc.
Familiarity with AWS and Google Cloud big data products

What we offer

A highly competitive compensation package
401k with company match
Paid vacation, work from home, and sick days
Designated time to work on company-related projects you feel strongly about
Macbook Pros and any other equipment you need to work effectively from home

Jun Group is a high-powered, collaborative environment. We are looking for candidates who work well in teams, enjoy learning, and challenge the status quo. We work hard, and we have lives, too. We pay competitively based on experience, and we're open to allowing the right person to learn our industry on the job.

We have excellent perks and benefits, and we welcome diversity and non-traditional paths into all of our roles. We believe in hiring the right person as opposed to the right combination of keywords.

About the team

The Content Integrity team's mission is to help customers detect and prevent all forms of spam, scam, and abusive activity done via content generation. We help all sorts of online businesses including marketplaces, communities, dating sites, social networks and messaging services foster healthy interactions between their users and keep unwanted content off their platforms.

What we are looking for

As a software engineer on the Content Integrity team, you will work closely with product managers, data scientists and other software engineers to deliver various Content Integrity product features, which are at the intersection of machine learning and distributed systems. Specifically, you will

Build highly scalable, distributed microservices that can handle hundreds of millions of events per day
Build offline experimentation systems used to simultaneously evaluate tens of thousands of models
Scale machine learning pipelines used to produce thousands of models derived from terabytes of data
What would make you a strong fit
Experience with Java, Scala, C#, C++, or other object-oriented languages
Experience with distributed systems development
Strong software engineering fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems, and strong debugging, testing, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output
You are a self-starter, with a quick learning curve.

Bonus points

2+ years experience working with large datasets using Spark, MapReduce, or similar technologies
2+ years experience building distributed backend systems using Java, Scala, C++, or other object-oriented languages
Experience with cloud infrastructure (e.g. GCP, AWS, Azure)
Experience with HBase, BigTable, Kafka, ZooKeeper.
Familiarity with practical challenges in ML systems, such as feature extraction and definition, data validation, training, monitoring, and management of features and models.

A little about us:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

Benefits and perks:

Competitive total compensation package
401k plan
Medical, dental and vision coverage
Wellness reimbursement
Education reimbursement
Flexible time off

Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.

This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

JobTitle: Director, Melville Supply Chain Technology Lead
Content_text:
Position Summary
The primary role of the Melville IT Technology Lead is to shape the Campus IT SC function strategy through technology leadership and deliver solutions to achieve the strategy and drive competitive advantage. This position plays a critical role in both advising the campus leadership as well as identifying, prioritizing and delivering projects that support ELC's long term growth opportunities.
In addition, this position manages the campus solutioning process across multiple process areas: Planning; Operations, Procurement, Distribution, Quality and New Product Launch. This role partners directly with the America’s Regional IT Supply Chain Technology Lead to attain and retain top talent.
This role will be a key technology advisor to the America’s Regional Supply Chain IT Technology Lead and be part of his/her staff to drive business outcomes through technology. This is a true business partner role requiring a point of view and the ability to make proactive recommendations.
This position is based in Melville reports into the America’s Regional Supply Chain IT Technology Lead.
Key Roles & Responsibilities
Act as the primary point of contact and technology business partner to the Campus leadership and delivers value by shaping and informing the business strategy, defining capabilities required to achieve the strategy and bringing forth recommended technology solutions to enable these capabilities.
Accountable for the Melville Supply Chain Technology portfolio. This includes running regular portfolio planning and progress updates with the Campus Supply Chain Operations team. Driving the development of business cases and representing the function in IT Alignment sessions. Ultimately accountable for Technology Investment funds (budget $3M+).
Work collaboratively across the IT organization to ensure all technology services needs are identified in a timely way and communicated, planned and budgeted effectively. Must effectively communicate and collaborate with Brand and Region Technology teams.
Ensure the realization of the business strategies through technology and continued process improvements. Align tightly with the BIA organization and collaborate to ensure excellent information flow and availability to enable the best data driven, consumer connected enterprise.
Ensures the strategic agenda is serviced by strong data and analytic services including data science, analytic productionalizing and ongoing support.
Coordinate with technology providers to evaluate new and innovative technologies and service offerings. Responsible for the teams who develop business requirements, coordinates with enterprise architects (enterprise, solution, information….) to ensure new services and solutions align with roadmaps.
Overall IT accountability for keeping the Melville Manufacturing Site up and running 24 x7 x 365 . Responsible for partnering with all parts of the IT organization to make sure that happens.

Qualifications
Leadership Skills
Excellent leadership skills and demonstrated experience with building and developing teams
Act as a Functional Technology Leader – demonstrating outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, ability influence and provide technology thought leadership to Melville Supply Chain Leadership and act as a trusted advisor.
Highly collaborative relationship building skills with various internal and external stakeholders – ensuring Melville priorities are adequately represented in front of global IT and supply chain teams through various meeting groups.
Must demonstrate a high sense of urgency to influence changes and drive outcomes from conception to delivery.
Effective business communicator, with high emotional quotient and excellent executive presence. Candidate should be an effective story-teller and be able to swiftly align and mobilize disparate teams by setting a vision common goal
Manage the Melville SC portfolio.
Technical Skills
Experience and demonstrated success leading and delivering medium to large transformation programs enabled by technology. Implementation experience in core technologies such as SAP, WMS, MES, LIMS is important.
Expertise in application design/architecture, integration architecture development, enterprise application integration, and integration technologies solutions and standards.
Demonstrates technical domain experience and expertise in Manufacturing Supply Chain processes.
Hands on experience and demonstrated success in leading digital solutions and familiarity with new technologies (IoT; Machine Learning; Robotics / Process Automation; Deep Learning
Competent in new technology evaluation, ability to support technical change management and provide thought leadership skills in integration technologies, tools and services
Business Skills
Solid understanding of supply chain processes End to End (Plan, Source, Make, Distribute, Quality, Transport)
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking abilities. Experience in using data and data science to drive quantitative analysis and break-through outcomes.
Intense focus on business outcomes, demonstrating the ability to have material impacts on core business measures: e.g.: Inventory; Order Fill Rate, Forecast Accuracy; Attainment; Fill Rate, Asset Utilization; Cost Optimization
Is continuously learning and is curious. Keeps abreast of best in class supply chain practices and is familiar with the competitive practices and technologies.

JobTitle: Senior Software Development Engineer - Personalization & Rec...
Content_text:
3+ years of programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
2+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
4+ years of professional software development experience
Highly motivated self-starter with bias for innovative thinking
1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems

Want to help invent next generation technologies in recommender systems? Are you looking for roles that impact millions of customers a day, with opportunities to drive billions of dollars in impact? We’ve got the perfect job for you.

Amazon’s Personalization team is looking for a software development engineer to work on the core website optimization systems for all of Amazon. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team, working on one of the largest scale machine learning systems in the company. You will hone your skills in areas such as big data processing, deep learning, multi-armed bandits, and reinforcement learning while building scalable industrial systems. As a member of a highly leveraged team of talented engineers and ML scientists, you will have a unique opportunity to help determine what content gets shown to every customer on Amazon.

As a member of the team, you will use big data, machine learning and analytical techniques to design and implement scalable solutions for business problems. You bring strong thought leadership, great judgment, clear communication skills, and strong track record of delivery. We are building the next generation optimization system that powers the biggest internet retailer on earth, and we hope you will join us!


Master degree in Machine Learning or related field.
8+ years of experience in software development.
Experience developing recommendation and optimization systems.
Experience writing computationally efficient software for production systems that utilize large datasets.
Have an understanding of the scientific theory behind machine learning techniques
Understanding of practical considers that need to be addressed when applying machine learning techniques to customer problems

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

Company Overview
We are a global, independent IT advisory firm with deep domain expertise across every layer of the technology stack, from business applications and platforms down to core infrastructure. Our consultants have decades of experience helping clients promote best practice in every IT discipline. All of our consultants – from our senior leaders to recent hires – are experienced industry practitioners. They have first-hand experience of the challenges our customers face. And while they each bring their own unique perspectives and expertise, they all share a passion for putting the customer first in everything they do. We are currently seeking a Data Modeler to work on a project to migrate fully off all an existing systems onto a new data model so will need to map out what that will mean. This project will be on a contract basis.
Responsibilities:
Work on the development of conceptual, logical, and physical data models, the implementation of RDBMS, operational data store (ODS), data marts, and data lakes on target platforms (SQL/NoSQL).
Delivering Best-in-Class user experience in Metadata Management/Data Catalog area and pro-actively resolving any escalations or issues raised in respect to the operational delivery
Implementing metadata standards, automating data governance procedures and ensuring data accessibility across multiple platforms.
Ensure increased control of our data and it’s data lineage by focusing on data operations & control on what is required by securities processes
Ensure data sets are complete, and represent exhaustively our Target Operating Model
Implement business and IT data requirements through new data strategies and designs across all data platforms (relational, dimensional, and NoSQL) and data tools (reporting, visualization, analytics, and machine learning).
Knowledge of metadata management technologies and methods of storing reference data and definitions
Work with business stakeholders and application/solution teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and develop conceptual/logical/physical data models
Requirements:
Expertise in data modelling principles/methods including conceptual, logical & physical Data Models
5+ years of hands-on relational, dimensional, and/or analytic experience (using RDBMS, dimensional, NoSQL data platform technologies, and ETL and data ingestion protocols).
Knowledge of more than one financial asset class - systems, tools, processes
Experience with data warehouse, data lake, and enterprise big data platforms in multi-data-centre contexts required.
Good knowledge of metadata management, data modelling, and related tools (Erwin or ER Studio or others) required.
Experience in working with combined on-, near- or offshore technology delivery teams
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Citihub Digital is committed to fostering and sustaining a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment where all individuals feel valued and respected.

Content_text: Data Acquisition EngineerReporting to the Chief Data Officer New York, NYCOVID-19 has created a new social, political and economic world order – one that is increasingly driven by cultural narratives and online discourse. NWO’s bleeding-edge technology enables clients to surface the fears, motivations and demand drivers underlying various trends, providing them with unprecedented access to the why behind a narrative. NWO’s platform is already in use by Fortune 500 brands to empower key resource allocation decisions.Following an impressive seed-funding-round in 2020, we are scaling fast and searching for a talented Data Acquisition Engineer that enjoys solving complex data processing problems at scale, exploring and onboarding new data sets, and in particular, web scraping. You’ll spend your time building reliable, scalable web scrapers and data pipelines, geared toward producing the datasets that power our product (at the intersection of NLP, time series forecasting, and trend detection). Data is at the heart of everything we do, and as such, your work will have a massive impact on the future trajectory of the product.Required: Passionate about web scraping and familiar with techniques and tools for crawling, extracting and processing data - e.g. Selenium, BeautifulSoup, Scrapy, etc.Experience with Linux/UNIX, HTTP, HTML, Javascript and NetworkingExpertise in Python & SQLExperience with at least a couple of the following:Cloud operations and architectures, especially for data-heavy applications - specifically on GCP and with BigQueryJob scheduling & orchestration frameworks - e.g. Jenkins, Luigi, Airflow, message queues etc.Best practices for developing software (version control, CI/CD, automation, peer-programming, documentation, testing, etc.)Nice to haves: Natural language processing (NLP) experienceInterest in machine learning, and experience building ML-driven or algorithmic data productsA self-starting, intellectually curious, solutions-oriented mindsetPerks: Competitive compensation, including equity in a company with rapidly growing valuationExcellent health, dental and vision benefitsSupports working from homeSubsidized gym membershipPet-friendly officenwo.ai IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERJob Type: Full-timePay: $70,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offReferral programRelocation assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:New York, NY 10001: Reliably commute or willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location: One location

Exotanium, Inc. is searching for Container Runtime Software Engineers to build out our next-generation cloud-native container management platform. Our company has offices in Ithaca, NY and Santa Clara, CA, and we also offer remote positions across the United States.
Exotanium, a startup created by two professors and one graduated Ph.D. student from the Department of Computer Science at Cornell University, is a cloud resource optimization and management platform that uses Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to help enterprises reduce spending in the cloud by up to 90%, while enhancing both operational security and performance.
We recently closed a seed round and are looking for developers to join our brilliant, world-class team working to extend our next-generation containerization technology to new cloud providers, opening up our platform to a wide array of new customers.
Our team is passionate about maintaining our culture of diversity, and we especially encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We’re actively working to increase the diversity of experience and perspectives on our team and believe that this creates the best possible working environment for all and maximizes innovation.
Responsibilities:

Develop a new container runtime for cloud cost and resource optimizations.
Design and implement systems for automatic cloud resource management.
Optimize the performance and security of networking and storage architectures.
Work with customers on proof-of-concept prototypes and workflow integration.


Qualifications:

Bachelor or more advanced degree in Computer Science or related programs.
Extensive experience with cloud computing services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud etc.)
Extensive experience with developing virtualization, operating systems, container infrastructure and orchestration platforms using C/C++.
Strong background in developing distributed systems and multithreading programs.
Familiarity with Go and Linux environments.
Experience with extending and developing on the Xen platform is a big plus.
Comfortable working remotely if not relocated to Ithaca.


Compensation: Competitive salary Depends on Experience (DOE), Health, Dental and Vision Insurance, 401K with match, Paid Time Off (PTO), Long Term and Short Term Disabilities, Life Insurance.
We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

IPRO-Better healthcare, realized. That’s our vision. Across nearly 100 state and federal programs in 34 states, IPRO makes creative use of data science, clinical expertise, and emerging technology solutions to make the healthcare system work better. We’re a mission-driven, not-for-profit organization committed to delighting our customers and developing our employees.


GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will be part of a team that improves the quality of care delivered in a variety of settings, including hospitals, outpatient clinics, nursing homes, ESRD centers, and managed care plans. Your regular work will include collecting and reviewing data, developing analytic approaches, producing reports and dashboards, automating and validating data feeds, populating/promoting/documenting the data warehouse, and summarizing information for clients. You will also be involved in internal and client projects that leverage advanced analytic approaches, including regression analysis, ROI measurement, predictive modeling, machine learning, and more. Duties include but are not limited to:

Solves internal and external client data needs efficiently. Works with Data Analytics Team to probe business user needs to be sure that the ultimate deliverable will meet business requirements.
Automates ETL routines, data processing, validation reports, and other data management processes to respond to very complex requests.
Validates data through data checks, frequency analysis, and other approaches.
Optimizes data processing and storage. Works with internal clients and analysts to find ideal storage and formatting solutions.
Designs processes and outputs to support complex client needs. Works with clients to formalize data run schedules, then implements a schedule/automates data run initialization.
Ensures accuracy and integrity of all work. Reviews work of more junior analysts.
Oversees design and build of data warehouses. Builds ELT processes to convert and load data into standard structure. Consults with clients and team members to find new data or data linkages that would enhance projects and analysis.
Reports on processing fail states and provides comparative analysis of previous data runs along with recommendations on how to address any issues. Summarizes findings and recommendations for technical/clinical and nontechnical/ nonclinical audiences, as appropriate.
Ensures that all analyses use high-quality data. Develops strong understanding of data sources and works either with analytics staff or directly with data sources to ensure complete, accurate, and timely data.
Adheres to IPRO and customer security policies at all times. Designs and implements user security measures. Reviews security needs and makes recommendations.
Proponent of continuous quality improvement. Contributes regularly to improving data and analytics sophistication and efficiency within the department and IPRO as a whole.
Drives effective matrixed teamwork across IPRO and our client base. Regularly interfaces with IPRO and client senior team members and management.
Creates documentation (such as code detail, report specifications, narrative backup, and metadata) for all reports, validation logs, and automation processes. Creates and organizes table structure metadata and database documentation tables. Reviews documentation produced by more junior analysts.
Assigned ownership of large parts of department or corporate projects.
Develops good understanding of supported business processes, goals, and strategy to provide strong and relevant recommendations for solutions.
Trains and mentors more junior staff.


QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrated exceptional healthcare data management skills.
Experience with data and process automation techniques.
Strong proficiency and experience with data management tools, such as
relational database concepts/query tools (e.g., SQL, Metabase, MS Access)
Data management tools (e.g., Matillion)
BI Visualization Tools (e.g., Tableau, MS Excel)
Presentation tools (e.g., MS Word, MS PowerPoint)
Experience with several types of healthcare data (e.g., payer claims/membership/provider, lab, EMR, social determinants, patient-self reported data).
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Ability to communicate complex concepts orally and in writing to technical, leadership, and lay audiences using
Static tables/graphs and interactive dashboards
Written reports that clearly describe methods, findings, and recommendations in language appropriate for the audience
Presentations that are well crafted and articulately presented
Solid understanding of US healthcare system—and the types of data generated and used for analytics
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time


EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

 Bachelor's Degree required; Master's Degree preferred
4 years of experience doing healthcare analytics work; time spent in a Master’s or PhD program can be counted as experience


IPRO offers competitive salaries, comprehensive health and dental coverage.

IPRO is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Accenture - REPL Data Science Consultant
Location: Negotiable
We are…
We are a global collective of innovators applying the New every day to improve the way the world works and lives. New doesn’t mean being ahead of the curve; new is pushing forward the curve, riding the edge where the impossible meets the transformational and making it reality where it matters. Help us show the world what’s possible as you partner with clients to unlock hidden value and deliver innovative solutions. Empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of diverse talent and perspectives, we drive success in a new business architecture that disrupts conventional practices. Our expertise spans 40+ industries across 120+ countries and impacts millions of lives every day. We turn ideas into reality.
The data science team are part of the delivery consulting team, delivering a data science consulting offering across a wide portfolio of clients and services. As such, we are working on a broad spectrum of activities, ranging from algorithms development, data analysis and software development support.
The Work…Data analysis using either an exploratory or hypothesis driven approaches.Predictive modelling using machine learning techniques such as generalized linear models and Bayesian inference, and Deep Learning.Work side-by-side with clients to provide bespoke data science consultations.Contribute to the development, and ongoing improvement of our in-house platforms.Provide data science expertise and support as required to the wider organization.
Travel Note:
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.

Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here’s what you need…
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience)
Minimum of 1 year experience with Machine Learning, R, Python or Power BI
Minimum of 1 year experience in Data Analysis and Data Visualization
Nice to have…
Minimum of 1 year experience in a client facing role
Strong related academic background i.e. Masters level degree in numerate subject, preferably data science
Theoretical knowledge of classical statistical methods, bayesian learning, and neural networks, and its application to machine learning techniques
Demonstrable experience with RStudio or Jupyter notebooks.
Keen to utilize up-to-date software development practices.
Experience with Tensor Flow or Hadoop
Experience with high level software language such as Scala, Java or C++
Experience of working in an Agile development environment
Experience of software containers e.g. Docker
Comfortable working with different data science tools

ABOUT FANDUEL GROUP

FanDuel Group is a world-class team of brands and products all built with one goal in mind — to give fans new and innovative ways to interact with their favorite games, sports, teams, and leagues. That's no easy task, which is why we're so dedicated to building a winning team. And make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give.

FanDuel Group is based in New York, with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon and Scotland. Our brands include:

FanDuel — A game-changing real-money fantasy sports app
FanDuel Sportsbook — America's #1 sports betting app
TVG — The best-in-class horse racing TV/media network and betting platform
FanDuel Racing — A horse racing app built for the average sports fan
FanDuel Casino & Betfair Casino — Fan-favorite online casino apps
FOXBet — A world-class betting platform and affiliate of FanDuel Group
PokerStars — The premier online poker product and affiliate of FanDuel Group

THE POSITION
Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to tackle our most challenging problems, mainly in our digital marketing initiatives. Throughout the lifecycle of a model, from data collection through results, you will create predictive models to drive actionable insights across FanDuel Group. You will promote effective communication of model outputs and contribute to a collaborative code environment.

THE GAME PLAN
Everyone on our team has a part to play
Construct models, analyses and solutions in response to a question or problem posed by a stakeholder or colleague
Develop, iterate and take to production advanced machine learning models
Proactively seek opportunities or problems to be analyzed
Choose the 'best' approach given available resources
Presents to senior leaders confidently and with impact
Work with decision-makers across the company to understand their goals, identify opportunities to use data to develop new insights and improve business results
Bring efficiency and automation in the data infrastructure
Create dashboards and data visualizations for analysis and communication
Opportunity to mentor and or coach more junior data scientists

THE STATS
What we're looking for in our next teammate

Minimum of 3 years of industry experience in data science, analytics or engineering preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skill – we are looking for great communicator as well as great technical mind
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with high proficiency in Python and SQL (or coding language of choice)
Expert in building and using models to help create production level products and tools
Proficient with command line tools and GitHub
Familiarity with CICD pipeline
Ability to work across teams, locations and time zones
Interest or experience in Fantasy Sports and/or Sports Gaming
Bachelor's Degree in a highly numerate major (Math, Stats, CS, etc.) or relevant experience in data science preferred
Preferred: Experience working with digital marketing related data science projects
Preferred: Experience with Spark/Databricks

THE CONTRACT
We treat our team right

Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:

An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
Mentorship and professional development resources to help you refine your game
Flexible vacation allowance to let you refuel
Hall of Fame benefit programs and platforms

FanDuel Group is an equal opportunities employer. Diversity and inclusion in FanDuel means that we respect and value everyone as individuals. We don't tolerate bias, judgement or harassment. Our focus is on developing employees so that they reach their full potential.

JobTitle: MQA Markets Quantitative Analysis Full Time Associate
Content_text:
The AVP Quantitative Analyst is a junior model developer role within Markets Quantitative Analysis (MQA), the Markets front office quant group. This role requires a strong mathematical and programming background to develop and implement the quantitative models. The role also requires relevant experience with data analysis. MQA covers all major asset classes including FX, rates, credit, commodities, equities, mortgages, and algos/electronic execution.


Responsibilities:
Apply mathematical theories and no-arbitrage pricing techniques to develop, maintain and enhance the pricing and risk models used by the Markets businesses
Develop analytical tools leveraging various data analysis techniques including machine learning for use by the desk to analyze their portfolios
Collaborate closely with key stakeholders such as Traders and technology professionals
Work in close partnership with control functions such as Market Risk, Model Validation Group, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure
Adhere to all policies and procedures as defined by your role which will be communicated to you
Obtain and maintain all registrations/licenses which are required for your role, within the appropriate timeframe
Be familiar with and adhere to Citi’s Code of Conduct and the Plan of Supervision for Global Markets and Securities Services; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency
Qualifications:
2-3 years of experience in a comparable quantitative modeling or analytics role, ideally having worked in the similar financial firms. Outstanding relevant academic research may count toward years of experience
Must have advanced mathematical background; Statistics and Probability
Solve analytical equations and design numerical schemes to provide non-analytical solutions.
Must have technical/programming skills; experience with languages like python, C++ or Java
Must have some relevant experience in data analysis gained through either previous work experience or projects at school
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Education:
A PhD or Master’s in a technical discipline such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, quantitative finance, operations research or similar
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Come join us and make great things happen!EagleView is a fast-growing technology company driving game changing innovation in multibillion-dollar markets such as property insurance, energy, construction, and government. Leveraging 17 years of the most advanced aerial imaging technology in the world, along with the most recent advances in machine learning and AI, EagleView is fundamentally transforming how our customers do business.At EagleView, we believe that making our culture engaging and empowering are keys to success. Our social, athletic, and wellness opportunities are plentiful; and the growth, education, and potential of employees is a top priority, making EagleView a “Best Place to Work” for more than five years running.The Operations Data Analyst will serve as a key member of the Operations Data & Analytics Office (ODAO), within the Center of Excellence (CoE). This role will lead the gathering and analysis of information related to the management and performance of the Operations teams. The successful candidate will have as his/her core responsibility the data analysis, benchmarking, and process improvement for the Operations organization and its continuous drive to improve efficiency.The successful candidate will have a proven capability to gather relevant data from multiple, disparate sources and bring it together in a meaningful way that allows leaders to effectively monitor and manage their business. The incumbent will have the required experience to turn data into information, form hypotheses and prove/disprove these hypotheses through in-depth analytics.Selected success criteria in this role will include:Primary Responsibilities: Create visual and tabular data elements that clearly identify the main drivers of operational efficiency;Triage requests and gather user requirements to effectively fulfill business needs;Work with internal stakeholders to determine the most effective method of gathering needed data elements, and build a repeatable process to integrate the data sets into a deliverable;Partner with the Operations team to dissect incoming data, assess performance, and target areas of opportunity;Maintain a suite of dashboards that compare current performance to goal as well as to past performance;Other duties as assigned.Required Knowledge, Skills and Experience: 2-4 Years proven experienceStrong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, SQL, and relational databases;Proficiency with data visualization tools, particularly Power BI;Proven ability to collaborate through multiple levels of an organization and drive results;Demonstrated experience in using data to recommend courses of action;Strong written and verbal communications skills.Preferred - Four-year degree, ideally with a concentration in Business Analytics, Decision Modeling, or Statistical Analysis, or commensurate professional experience.Please apply here:  https://recruit.hirebridge.com/v3/CareerCenter/v2/details.aspx?cid=7600&jid=563470Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: newSystems Engineer, Clinical Decision Support Solutions, Remot...
Content_text:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter? Take a closer look.
Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. At Beckman Coulter, a Danaher company, we’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. At first glance, you’ll see we are dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and health care forward for more than 80 years. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you and you’ll have the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful. You’ll find the Danaher Business System , which makes everything possible.

And no matter where you look at Beckman Coulter, at the heart of what we do, you’ll witness our shared purpose—helping realize life’s potential—in action. Our work helps improve millions of lives.

We hope you’ll see yourself here, too. What you find at Beckman Coulter—and within yourself— might just change the world!

As the Systems Engineer, Clinical Decision Support Solutions , you will play a key role in the design, development and delivery of machine learning solutions for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics. In this role, reporting to the Director, Software and Systems Engineering, CDS Solutions, you will help shape an innovative digital diagnostics portfolio of new offerings that use machine learning and AI technology to improve clinical outcomes , and you will collaborate with a team of highly skilled software engineers and data scientists to deliver these predictive analytics to healthcare providers via EHR-integrated CDS solutions . You will accomplish this by being hands-on and collaborating with your team, other business groups, electronic health record (EHR) vendors, clinicians, and hospital IT teams. Your projects will leverage data from medical diagnostics and electronic health records to deliver actionable insights.
Essential Responsibilities
Work closely with product management, clinical, and marketing teams to clearly understand customer needs. Develop effective system performance requirements from customer/user requirements. Responsible for system requirements traceability and allocation to the subsystem teams.
Leverage VOC and guidance from internal stakeholders such as product management, service and sales to define system quality targets and service-level targets to ensure excellent customer experience.
Support planning and execution for technical design reviews and the retirement of technical risks as they arise to achieve best optimization in system performance and quality.
Support on time delivery of new product development milestones, adherence to Beckman QMS, and creation of technical artifacts from concept to closure. Work to ensure QMS compliance, DHF readiness & regulatory paperwork where applicable to enable CDS solutions clearance and commercialization. Identify opportunities to drive continuous improvement for efficiency and simplification to enable the engineering team to more easily, effectively and consistently facilitate the execution of projects. Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field with 5 years of relevant experience or a Master’s degree with 2 years of relevant experience. Demonstrated expertise in software systems design & requirements development with technical depth in software/systems engineering.
Knowledge of new product development process, development operations, continuous integration, Agile software development, and its impact on releasing quality products. Demonstrated skills in proactively identifying, facilitating and driving closure of actions and technical risks for a product.
Demonstrated ability to navigate through ambiguity and adapt to changing project situations.
Fast learner able to quickly become adept at using the Danaher Business System tools.
Experience working on FDA regulated products.

This role can be remote or based in one of Beckman Coulter’s offices in Brea, CA; Miami, FL; or Chaska, MN.

Beckman Coulter offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates’ and their families’ lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com. We believe you’ll like what you see!

Beckman Coulter is a Danaher Operating Company.

At Danaher, we’re driven by a sense of wonder for what we can create—and what we can become. Here, you’ll accelerate your career while driving innovation that improves lives. You’ll work hard and take risks, with guidance from committed leaders, powerful DBS tools, and the support of a global organization.

If you’d like to learn more, read stories from our associates on our Careers Blog or reach out to one of our recruiters.

Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available here .
Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call +91-XXXXXXXXXX or email applyassistance@danaher.com to request accommodation.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies require all US and Puerto Rico employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID–19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation as required by law.

-COVID-19 Hiring Update-

As the health and safety of our candidates and our employees come first, we're excited to provide virtual experiences for interviews and new hire on-boarding. Currently, reopening of offices is planned for January 2022.
Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 800+ talented people across eight offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!
Who you are:

You're the person that other engineers come to for help solving the hardest problems. You have deep technical expertise and have earned the respect of your peers. You have built the back end platforms, pipelines and infrastructure to support machine learning. Demonstrated excellent problem solving skills and solid understanding of computer science fundamentals, including commonly used algorithms and data structures. Worked with distributed systems using microservices architecture. Built applications with OO languages (preferably in Java or Scala), using SQL and NoSQL data stores, and run them in containers in a cloud environment.

What success looks like in your first 6 months:
In this role, you will build the services and underlying infrastructure that allows us to deal with terabytes of unstructured data and:

contribute code to production systems from the get-go.
spend time with different parts of the company to understand how Dataminr works.
get up to speed on our tech stack and infrastructure with overview sessions and deep dives with your team.
share responsibility for several microservices and design significant features that impact multiple services.
be influential in helping plan the next iterations of our architecture as we strive to get more alerts to our clients faster and with near-perfect reliability.
Lead important cross-team initiatives and mentor junior engineers.

Why you should work here:

We recognize and reward hard work with:
company paid benefits for employees and their dependents, including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance
401(k) savings plan with company matching
flexible spending account for out-of-pocket medical, transit, parking and dependent care expenses
We want you to be your best, authentic self by supporting you with:
a diverse, driven, and passionate team of coworkers who want you to succeed
individual learning and development fund and professional training
generous paid time off; including sick leave and 100% company paid parental leave
remote working friendly perks such as expanded telehealth options for mental and physical well being, virtual yoga, meditation and health and fitness app reimbursements

Company Description
TIDAL is a global music and entertainment streaming platform committed to creating a deeper connection between artists and fans through its library of more than 70 million songs, over 250,000 high quality videos, and available in over 60 countries. In addition, TIDAL offers its subscribers exclusive access to high-profile music and music videos, original content series, podcasts, documentaries, livestream concerts, tickets, merchandise and live experiences. Together, TIDAL and Square will be music-obsessed and artist-focused while we explore new artist tools, listener experiences, and access to financial systems that help artists be successful.

Job Description
We are in search of a Data Scientist who can help unlock a greater understanding of our customers and our platform. You will lead the development of various technical solutions that address the data and information needs for teams across the company, with a particular focus within the marketing organization.
You will become an integral part of TIDAL and will develop the core of our marketing analytics and customer understanding. Those solutions will help bring to light actionable insights to improve business decisions and provide better experiences for our customers. Our tech stack currently includes AWS, Spark, Redshift, Postgres, Airflow, Tableau, and Databricks. You will report to the Head of Analytics.

Qualifications
You Will:
Clarify loosely defined problems or business objectives across the marketing organization and devise useful metrics and technical solutions that support data-driven decision making
Partner with Data Engineering to implement analytics-specific data layers; this includes internal subscription and platform usage data, as well as enhancements from external vendors such as Google Analytics, Adjust, Braze, and other platforms in the marketing tech stack
Leverage latest methodologies in experimentation, modeling and statistical analysis to solve business problems, and translate findings into actionable recommendations
Partner with Head of Analytics and Data Engineering to modernize preexisting data processes and team best practices
Troubleshoot issues in data pipelines and reporting packages
Additional Information
You Have:
4+ years of experience in quantitative analytics, data science, and analytical consulting
Experience with analytical SQL; this role will work with an array of disparate data sources so experience writing efficient, performance-optimized queries is a must
Familiarity with a programming language typically used for statistical analysis and machine learning (preferably Python)
Hands-on experience with self-service analytics tools (e.g.Tableau, Looker)
Training in econometrics and statistics, with experience applying the relevant methodologies; a thorough understanding of statistical inference is required
Familiarity with marketing concepts such as user segmentation, customer journeys, user churn and lifetime value

JobTitle: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Machine Learning Methods...
CompanyLocation: New York, NY 10012 (Greenwich Village area)+16 locations
Content_text:
New York University: NYU - NY: Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences
Location
New York
Open Date
Nov 22, 2019
Description
A postdoctoral research position is available in Machine Learning Methods in Atmospheric Sciences at the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences as part of a research effort on the applications of data-driven methods to solve multi-scale problems in physical sciences. We seek an outstanding data scientist and/or physical scientist interested in investigating novel approaches to the scientific modeling of natural phenomena across different disciplines including climate science, solid state physics, material science and urban engineering.

Qualifications
The successful candidate will work under the supervision of Prof. O. Pauluis (Courant Instutute) and will collaborate directly with scientists at New York University, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, University of Minnesota, SUNY Binghampton and the US Naval Academy.
The duties include the conceptualization and development of machine learning approaches relevant to atmospheric flows, their implementation in numerical codes, and the dissemination of these results to scientific presentation and articles.

Application Instructions
Start date is negotiable, with a target of January 1, 2020. The initial term of the appointments will be one year, renewable for a second year. A competitive salary will be offered, plus benefits. Research funds are also available. Please submit a CV, a 2-4 page research statement, and names and contact information for at least three references.

Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
A Bachelor’s degree or higher
3+ years experience in program or project management
Experience defining and executing against program requirements

Hundreds of millions of customers. Billions of products for sale. Billions of queries and billions of dollars in revenue. The scale and impact of Amazon Search is huge. The Amazon Search team, responsible for the one of the largest search engines, creates powerful, customer-focused search solutions and technologies. Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, Amazon Search services go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant systems used by millions of Amazon customers world wide every day. Our team is growing and we are looking for passionate individuals who are motivated to improve customer experience by leveraging techniques like machine learning (ML), and make Amazon Search feel like a trusted friend that can help customers explore our vast selection and find just the right product.

We are looking for a strong program managers to lead the execution of two key initiatives for the Search organization. The role is part of the Search Science and Artificial Intelligence team and our vision is to provide the most meaningful shopping experience for anyone and for anything related to shopping. As the Program Manager, you will lead the execution of Search Science team's new product and program visions to develop key metrics that measure and improve customer experience across the whole search page.

To be successful in this role, you will be customer obsessed, have excellent communication (written and verbal) skills, be able to work cross-functionally, drive consensus, and ship solutions. You have had experience working in a high pace environment, are able to move fast, and are comfortable in working in an ambiguous environment. You like to tackle challenging problems and drive high profile projects and goals. In this role, you will work with global teams - both internal to Search, and external partners across entire Amazon to identify and prioritize needs, distil and articulate their needs into requirements for our tech teams, and effectively influence up and across the organization. This is a highly visible role that gives you an opportunity to partner with machine learning scientists, engineers, product managers and leaders to define, identify and measure customer experiences that eventually leads to our customers having a delightful shopping experience at Amazon.

This role will help the team focus on programs managing Search initiatives end to end that’ll delight customers in surprising ways. On a day-to-day basis, you'll be part of a small, close-knit team of applied scientists, engineers and product managers who understand, measure and innovate on customer experiences in an agile, highly collaborative manner. You will invent scalable, end-to-end shopping experiences at Amazon. The outcome of your hard work will be key performance indicators (KPIs) that will be used by teams across the entire company to create delightful shopping experience for our customers. This is an excellent opportunity for someone in a non-tech role looking to eventually transition into a technical program manager or a Product Manager role.

Preferred Qualifications: You will have experience working on search engines or some aspect of Search, and/or e-commerce. You have managed projects in a software development environment with high impact, are comfortable presenting projects/program updates to leaders, and managed teams that don’t report directly to you. You understand basics of Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence, and how they are used to solve modern day business problems.

Joining this team, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), Earth's most customer-centric company and one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California. Location can be in New York, NY, Palo Alto, CA or Seattle, WA.


MBA or advance degree in an equivalent field
Experience in an online retailer, or electronics manufacturer
Knowledge of customer operations, or technical support
Strong analytic and quantitative skills, A/B test, statistics
Experience of driving long term strategy from initiation to implementation
Comfortable working in a diverse group and contributing to an inclusive culture

About this role:
We're looking for a curious, driven and scrappy Senior Product Manager to come scale our core insurance product or launch a new product in one of our emerging verticals. You will mentor a group of product managers, set operating principles and continue refining our best practices. You will also partner with our incredible engineering, design and research teams to continue making magic for our users. If you are deeply analytical, creative, relentlessly inquisitive and want an opportunity to disrupt a massive industry, join us!
About you:
Creative problem-solver: No challenge is too complex, no issue is too hard, and “no” is not an acceptable answer.
Tenacious: You’re a hustler at heart and you thrive under pressure. Simply put, you get shit done.
Data-driven: You're extremely analytical and live in data. At the same time, you're confident enough to make decisions when the data is limited.
Super organized: You balance a packed schedule, an endless to-do list, can manage a team, and never let anything drop.
Requirements:
Proven track record leading a consumer-facing product in a mobile app environment
Experience defining metrics and making good product and strategic decisions based on quantitative and qualitative feedback
Ability to formulate great hypotheses and validate the impact of a feature on end-users through rigorous analysis
Experience weathering an early startup environment a definite asset
About Jerry:
Jerry is building the first Super App to save car owners time and money on all their car expenses. Drivers deserve better. That’s why we’re committed to making shopping for insurance, financing, maintenance, repairs, parking and more just a few clicks, texts, or swipes away.
Jerry is taking processes that haven’t substantively changed in decades and reimagining and redesigning them. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots, Jerry eliminates the need for long forms and phone calls while providing personalized services for all car-owners’ needs.
Today, Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in its category and the fastest way to compare and buy car insurance. We have more than 1M customers and we are just getting started. Join our team of curious and passionate people who love tackling real-world problems and be a part of building a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.
Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $130 million in financing.

About Us

Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.

About the Role

Data scientists play a central role in Twitch's data-driven decision-making process. As a data scientist at Twitch, you will shape the way product performance is measured, identify questions that guide our product strategy, apply machine learning methods to uncover new insights, and scale our analytic methods and tools to support our growing business.

The Commerce team at Twitch is dedicated to building products and tools that help streamers make a living doing what they love. We are looking for an experienced data scientist to help develop new revenue streams for our creators, and enhance our existing offerings. Our ideal candidate is a full-stack data powerhouse who is experienced in driving product decisions throughout the product lifecycle using data and experimentation. You will join our talented team of engineers, product managers, designers, and analysts in bringing new streamer support products from idea to launch.

You Will:
Inform strategies and prioritization through insights derived from in-depth data analysis
Identify opportunities to use machine learning techniques to enhance and personalize our product offerings
Leverage statistical and analytic models to uncover insights, segmentations, and predictions that drive the business forward and help us uncover new product opportunities
Use A/B experiments to guide product direction with iterative innovation and measurement
Define and implement core metrics for product teams
Develop automated dashboards and other self-service reporting tools to surface important data to stakeholders
Develop scalable data pipelines to support analytics needs
Evaluate and forecast impact of product features on creators, viewers, and the entire Twitch ecosystem
You Have:
4+ years of experience as a data scientist or data analyst in a high-velocity product development environment
Expert fluency in SQL-based data manipulation
In-depth knowledge of A/B experiment design and able to leverage the results to guide product decisions
In-depth experience using scripting languages such as R or Python for data analysis and machine learning techniques
High level of comfort creating dashboards in Tableau or comparable software
Impact-oriented, customer-centric approach to data analysis
Bonus Points
Experience with causal analysis or fraud detection
Experience building data products
Passion about online communities, games, and Twitch
Perks
Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k)

Flexible PTO
Commuter Benefits
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)
Breakfast & Lunch Served Daily


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, or other legally protected status.

The Digital Student Solutions (“DSS”) Segment includes direct-to-student product and service offerings to assist students to study more effectively and improve academic performance, thus enabling them to gain the valuable skills necessary to succeed after college. DSS is comprised of the operations of Student Brands, LLC, a leading direct-to-student subscription-based writing services business, and bartleby, a direct-to student subscription-based offering providing textbook solutions, expert questions and answers, AI-based writing assistance, and tutoring services.

Bartleby (bartleby.com) is a central offering in our developing ecosystem of direct-to-student digital products and services, accessible anytime and anywhere. bartleby.com provides critical services for students to achieve better success throughout their academic journey. The bartleby product offerings consist of bartleby learn™ comprised of textbook solutions (over 1,600 titles), question and answer solutions, and study guides; bartleby write™ comprised of revision, plagiarism, citation and scoring tools; and bartleby tutor™ comprised of online tutoring services.

The Role

As Director, Content Strategy and Innovation will be passionate about identifying, sourcing, and serving digital content. You will play an integral role in identifying content categories and modalities (i.e., video) that will improve outcomes for all learners. You will have led engaged, high-growth, data-driven editorial and content teams and will be responsible for providing thought leadership, fostering teamwork, and driving shared learning and mutual innovation across content and product.

You will be responsible for collaborating with subject matter experts, product, technology, marketing and content operations teams on-shore and off-shore to sharpen and productize ideas that have a direct impact on students and Bartleby increase traffic, drive conversion, and grow the LTV of our visitors and subscribers through retention and monetization. This role is responsible for driving the content direction and working closely with content operations to architect its production in-house and/or collaborate with external partners to license or syndicate content.

You use research and data to uncover consumer insights and inform the content roadmap. With a bias for action, you use market tests to sharpen ideas and scale the right initiatives that resonate with our end-users and help grow our business. In collaboration with our product managers, you will help shape the product roadmap to deliver content in a way that helps students learn better. You will partner closely with content operations to scale innovation efficiently.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Drive innovation and strategy for content for Bartleby with a customer focused lens. Understand the needs of current and potential customers and ensure we’re addressing them by building on the current assets and identifying new content opportunities.
Establish content roadmap, defining short-, medium- and long-term goals to align market opportunity with business objectives with the ability to clearly articulate our growth strategy and the KPIs we’ll measure against leveraging data driven observations.
Partner with content operations to establish production path for content ensuring we’re accurately serving our customers, creating efficiencies between teams while ensuring an accurate measure of content production and hold each piece we publish to the highest standards.
Establish the competitive landscape of existing content categories along the student’s learning path
Conduct research to sharpen understanding of student needs, validate concepts, and identify market fit (engaging all key market stakeholders – students, faculty, and administration)
Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together. Leverage technology enablers like machine learning, personalization, recommendation to improve relevance and efficiency
Collaborate cross-functionally to inform content delivery roadmap and define the go-to-market strategy.
Lead and cultivate a team an inclusive team of strategic content professionals who ideate, collaborate, co-edit and share in the team’s successes

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

7+ years experience in Content Strategy with experience driving innovation and developing a content roadmap, from internally managed content to licensed content for web/mobile applications. B2C experience a plus
Strong track record of developing experiences that have positive consumer feedback, adoption and engagement.
Demonstrated expertise working in complex, cross functional teams with strong influence, communication and partnership skills.
Experience leading user and/or market research. Foundational knowledge of SEO.
Ability to synthesize feedback from multiple areas (customer feedback, competitive analysis, metrics, usability) to drive continual improvements.
Helps identify, coach and develop to talent. A leader who can inspire, motivate and collaborate with others.
Navigate the complexities of diverse partnerships, engagements and diverse teams.
This position will require some flexibility in your schedule to occasionally interact with off-shore teams.
Experience in instructional design for the Higher Education/EdTech market a plus.
BA/BS, or equivalent experience. Prior business education or experience (i.e., Management Consulting, Finance, MBA) a plus.
